dt: {bc}a part added (as to a building or residential section)

dt.t: The clerk was a recent {wi}addition{/wi} to the staff.
a recipe enhanced by the {wi}addition{/wi} of freshly ground pepper

dt: {bc}the operation of combining numbers so as to obtain an equivalent simple quantity
{bc}direct chemical combination of substances into a single product

dt.t: The job requires a college degree and, {it}in addition{/it}, at least two years of experience.
{it}In addition to{/it} soup, several salads were served.

et: Middle English {it}addicioun,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French {it}addicion,{/it} borrowed from Latin {it}additiōn-, additiō,{/it} from {it}addi-,{/it} variant stem of {it}addere{/it} "to {et_link|add|add}" + {it}-tiōn-, -tiō,{/it} suffix of action nouns
shortdef: a part added (as to a building or residential section)
the act or process of adding; especially : the operation of combining numbers so as to obtain an equivalent simple quantity
